author: John Illman
title: Chris Bulstrode: volunteered for the army as a trauma surgeon in his 50s
text:
Chris Bulstrode: volunteered for the army as a trauma surgeon in his 50sBMJ //doi.org/10.1136/bmj.q133(Published q133
- John Illman
- London, UK
- john{at}jicmedia.org
Chris Bulstrode’s wish to join the army elicited loud laughter in the recruiting office. He was 56, 20 years over the maximum standard enlistment age, but he was a Boys’ Own kind of man and the army was desperately short of doctors. He was also—surprisingly—a highly controversial, left leaning, non-conformist pacifist.
He had exemplary credentials as professor of orthopaedic surgery at the University of Oxford’s Green Templeton College, and consultant at John Radcliffe Hospital and Nuffield Orthopaedic Centre. Having taken up his chair in 1992, he left in 2008 to become the oldest officer trainee at Sandhurst royal military academy. He said, “I found myself there with all these 20 year olds, learning to polish boots and dismantle a rifle.”
It was not an easy time. Bulstrode was fit and strong for a man of his age, but he lost two stones in six weeks. He was such a bad marcher that he was taken out at dawn by a sergeant major for additional practice before the passing out ceremony.
Territorial Army
His phone call to the army recruiting office had followed a “stultifying General Medical Council meeting.” As a GMC member for several years he had tried to drive change, but the council, he told Victoria Hunt, his second wife and partner for the last 25 years, “didn’t do change.” …

author: Roger A. Agana
title: Dutch Government Funds Africa’s Climate Resilience with US$27 Million
text:
ARC Ltd. has secured a $27 million contribution from the Dutch government aimed at bolstering climate resilience across Africa.
The funding will be administered through the African Development Bank’s Africa Disaster Risk Financing Programme (ADRiFi) Multi-Donor Trust Fund, marking the Netherlands as the sixth donor to join this initiative. This support will specifically enhance the accessibility and affordability of parametric insurance and other climate risk management tools across the continent.
Lesley Ndlovu, CEO of ARC Ltd., expressed gratitude for the Netherlands’ contribution, highlighting its pivotal role in reducing the protection gap and facilitating premium support to make parametric insurance more accessible.
Established in 2019, the ADRiFi programme, a collaboration between the African Development Bank and ARC Ltd., aims to expand insurance coverage against climate risks in Africa. Since its inception, the partnership has provided financial protection to over six million individuals, demonstrating significant progress in enhancing the continent’s resilience to climate shocks.
The programme’s success is underscored by robust support from international donors, including the United Kingdom, Switzerland, the United States, Canada, Norway, and now the Netherlands. With the Bank’s investment exceeding $100 million, 16 African countries have accessed sovereign insurance and financial protection against climate hazards.
Parametric insurance, a cornerstone of the initiative, ensures swift payouts based on predefined criteria such as cyclone intensity or rainfall excess, expediting financial assistance to affected communities. This mechanism plays a critical role in mitigating the socioeconomic impacts of natural disasters, particularly among vulnerable populations.
The ongoing efforts of the ADRiFi programme underscore a collective commitment to safeguard African nations against the escalating impacts of climate change, promoting sustainable development across the continent.

organizations.name: african development bank’s africa disaster risk financing programme

author: @elsoldepuebla1
title: Ya dan alimentos y techo a familiares de pacientes del Hospital General de Cholula
text:
En San Andrés Cholula hay un albergue que ofrece alimentos y un techo temporal a familiares que tiene un paciente en el Hospital General de Cholula, adscrito a la Secretaría de Salud de Puebla.
Este sitio, se ubica a las afueras de este centro hospitalario, situado sobre una arteria del Periférico-Ecológico, a la altura de Ciudad Judicial.
El único requisito para que las autoridades de San Andrés Cholula otorguen este beneficio, es que el interesado acredite tener a un familiar que recibe atención hospitalaria.
➡️ Únete al canal de El Sol de Puebla en WhatsApp para no perderte la información más importante
Dicho espacio cuenta con diferentes dormitorios y otras áreas funcionales en apoyo de las familias de otros municipios del interior del estado.
Por lo que, si cubres este requisito, es importante que aproveches la ayuda gubernamental, que los 365 días está vigente en este inmueble, ubicado en el territorio de este pueblo mágico.
Se debe comentar que, la presidenta municipal de San Andrés Cholula, Guadalupe Cuautle Torres, mencionó que por semana de 50 a 90 personas son atendidas en este refugio.
Aunque esta cifra puede disminuir o aumentar, ya que el comportamiento es variable o por temporadas.
También dijo que los huéspedes reciben alimentos a lo largo del día y otros servicios públicos, como derecho a una regadera, sanitarios, áreas de usos múltiples y una cama.
Aclaró que no sólo pobladores de los municipios más alejados pueden beneficiarse, sino también de la zona metropolitana de Puebla.
Esta ayuda es para quien lo necesite y se invita a que conozcan el albergue situado a unos metros del hospital, concluyó.

author: Andy Villamarzo
title: Maryland Coach of the Year Gets a Visit From Bill Belichick
text:
Maryland Coach of the Year Gets a Visit From Bill Belichick
Amid rumors about his contract situation with the University of North Carolina, Tar Heels head coach Bill Belichick spent Thursday traveling around the DMV recruiting.
The 6-time Super Bowl winning head coach stopped in at DeMatha Catholic High School (Maryland) and met High School On SI's Maryland Coach of the Year Bill McGregor.
Down below is the photo McGregor and Belichick took together, posted by the school's X page:
McGregor led the DeMatha (10-1) back to the state championship, when they won their first WCAC Capital Division championship since 2016.

author: Jessie Carbutt
title: 11 Influential Japanese LGBTQ+ Novels to Read
text:
From groundbreaking literary works to contemporary masterpieces, here are 11 of the most influential Japanese LGBTQ+ novels that offer a glimpse into the diverse experiences of Japan’s queer community.
Spanning from historical classics to modern breakthroughs, these authors provide rich, nuanced portrayals of love, self-discovery and resilience. They not only reflect the complexities of queer identity in Japanese society but also challenge conventions and open up discussions about acceptance and equality. Where available, we’ve also noted if an English translation exists for international readers.
1. The Co nfessions of a Mask (1949) – Yukio Mishima ( Available in English )
A seminal work in Japanese queer literature, Confessions of a Mask follows Kochan, a young man growing up in post-war Japan who struggles with his attraction to men while attempting to conform to societal expectations. Mishima’s semi-autobiographical novel is a deeply introspective examination of repression, self-deception, and the burden of maintaining a facade in a rigidly heteronormative world. Through poetic and often unsettling prose, this novel remains one of the most influential works in LGBTQ+ Japanese literature.
2. The Little House (2010) – Kyoko Nakajima ( Available in English )
Told from the perspective of an elderly housemaid recalling her past, The Little House is a nostalgic and emotionally rich narrative set in pre-war Tokyo. As she reflects on the family she served, subtle yet profound themes of same-sex attraction emerge, adding layers of complexity to an already intimate portrayal of love and secrecy. Nakajima delicately explores how societal norms and unspoken desires shape relationships, making this novel a quietly powerful read.
3. あのこは貴族 “Aristrocrats”(2009) – Mariko Yamauchi (Japanese only, English translation not yet announced) Set in contemporary Tokyo, this quietly incisive novel follows Hanako and Miki, two women from vastly different backgrounds connected through the same man. Hanako, raised in wealth, becomes engaged to Koichiro, a lawyer from a similar class. Miki, who dropped out of Keio University due to financial hardship, meets Koichiro while working at a lounge. Their affair continues even after his engagement.
As Hanako and Miki come to know each other, the novel unpacks the intersecting pressures of class, gender, and social mobility. Rather than focusing on romance, it explores a subtler kind of queerness—how women relate to each other within, and against, the roles society assigns them.
4. Lonely Castle in the Mirror (2017) – Mizuki Tsujimura ( Available in English ) This bestselling fantasy novel follows a group of isolated students who are magically transported to a mysterious castle, where they must navigate a world filled with secrets and unspoken truths. While not explicitly an LGBTQ+ novel, Lonely Castle in the Mirror subtly explores themes of identity, alienation, and self-acceptance, offering an allegory for the struggles of queer youth in Japan. Its emotionally resonant storytelling makes it a must-read for anyone who has ever felt like an outsider.
5. Breasts and Eggs (2020) – Mieko Kawakami ( Available in English ) A bold and thought-provoking novel, Breasts and Eggs delves into themes of body autonomy, gender, and class, centering around three women navigating their own personal struggles. One of its key subplots involves a transgender character confronting Japan’s rigid societal norms. Kawakami’s candid and unflinching prose challenges conventional narratives on womanhood and identity, making this a groundbreaking and essential read.
6. If Cats Disappeared from the World (2012) – Genki Kawamura ( Available in English ) While not explicitly LGBTQ+, this heart-wrenching novel explores themes of love, loss, and relationships. All through the story of a dying man bargaining with the devil to prolong his life. Within its tender narrative lies a subtle but profound contemplation of different forms of love. This includes those that defy traditional norms. Kawamura’s storytelling is simple yet deeply affecting, leaving readers with a lingering sense of introspection.
7. 火花 “Spark” (2015 ) – Naoki Matayoshi ( Available in English ) A witty and heartfelt novel about the struggles of an aspiring comedian, Spark offers an unexpected yet compelling romantic subplot. Matayoshi weaves humor and vulnerability into the narrative, highlighting the challenges of navigating queer identity in Japan’s male-dominated entertainment industry. The novel’s charm and emotional depth make it an engaging and thought-provoking read.
8. 飼育 “Prize Stock” ( 1958) – Kenzaburo Ooe (Available in English) This 1958 novella, which won the Akutagawa Prize, follows a young boy in a rural Japanese village during WWII as he and other children capture and interact with a downed Black American pilot. While not known as an LGBTQ+ work, some scholars have noted the homoerotic undertones in Ōe’s depiction of male characters and their intense, often physical interactions. These readings highlight how emotional and bodily intimacy between boys in Ōe’s writing can invite queer-adjacent interpretations, even if not explicitly intended.
9. Vita Sexualis (1909) – Ogai Mori (Available in English)
Often cited as one of the earliest examples of modern Japanese literature to openly address sexuality, Vita Sexualis is a fictionalized memoir of a man reflecting on his sexual development. Though not a queer novel in a modern sense, the narrator reflect on early same-sex experiences and attractions, including a schoolboy crush and interactions with male classmates. These moments are often described in a detached, clinical tone, but they are present and several scholars have examined how the novel’s repression, ambiguity, and emotional distance toward women can point to queer subtext or internalized desire, particularly in the context of Meiji-era masculinity. The book was banned shortly after publication, highlighting the discomfort it provoked around non-normative expressions of intimacy.
10. In Praise of Shadows (1933) – Jun’ichiro Tanizaki (Available in English)
While technically an extended essay rather than a novel, In Praise of Shadows is a poetic meditation on aesthetics, traditional architecture, and Japanese notions of beauty and sensuality. Tanizaki’s lingering descriptions of dimness, tactility, and the eroticism of obscured forms have fascinated queer theorists and readers alike. The essay’s sensual, moody tone—and its implicit contrast to modern Western rationalism—has led some to explore its queerness as an aesthetic and spatial sensibility rather than an identity.
11. Bath Towel (1996) – Jiro Fukushima (Available in Japanese only)
Nominated for the 115th Akutagawa Prize, Bath Towel is a short story that portrays a same-sex relationship between a high school teacher and his male student. Based on Fukushima’s own experiences as a teacher and poet in Kumamoto, the story explores desire, power, and taboo with raw emotional clarity. Fukushima later published an autobiographical novel revealing a relationship with Yukio Mishima, further cementing his cult status in queer literary circles.

author: mdr.de
title: Stadtrat beschließt: Fünf Kindergärten in Weimar werden geschlossen
text:
Demografischer Wandel Stadtrat beschließt: Fünf Kindergärten in Weimar werden geschlossen
Hauptinhalt
26. Juni 2025, 08:27 Uhr
Der Weimarer Stadtrat hat die Schließung von fünf Kindergärten beschlossen. Aufgrund des demografischen Wandels wird die Stadt bereits im kommenden Jahr Hunderte Kindergartenplätze nicht mehr benötigen.
In Weimar werden fünf Kindertagesstätten geschlossen. In sieben weiteren Kitas werden Plätze abgebaut. Nach langer Diskussion hat der Stadtrat am Mittwochabend einen neuen Kita-Bedarfsplan beschlossen. Er sieht vor, dass die Stadt bis zum Sommer 2026 insgesamt 500 Kindergartenplätze abbaut.
Nach Prognosen werden im März 2026 von den aktuell 3.448 Plätzen nur noch 2.570 belegt sein. Grund seien der demografische Wandel mit weniger Geburten und die damit einhergehende sinkende Kinderzahl.
Stadtratsfraktionen weisen Vorwürfe zurück
Der Abstimmung ging eine emotionale Diskussion voraus. Vorwürfe anwesender Eltern, der Prozess sei intransparent und nicht nachvollziehbar gewesen, wiesen so gut wie alle Fraktionsvertreter zurück. Sämtliche Ausschusssitzungen seien öffentlich und Vertreter des Stadt-Elternrates anwesend gewesen, sagte beispielsweise Dirk Rühling von den Grünen.
Auch die Linke hält die Einschnitte für notwendig, werde den Prozess und die Umsetzung jedoch kritisch begleiten, sagte Stadträtin Marit Haferkamp. CDU-Fraktionschef Jörg Geibert sieht ebenfalls keine Alternative, hält die beschlossenen Kita-Schließungen jedoch nur für einen ersten einschneidenden Schritt. Auch 2026 werde man wieder über Reduzierungen sprechen müssen.
Wolfram Wiese von der SPD und gleichzeitig Vorsitzender des Jugendhilfeausschusses sagte, dass niemand diese Entscheidung gern gefällt habe und es auch niemanden leichtgefallen sei. Wirtschaftlich seien hunderte freie Kita-Plätze jedoch nicht vertretbar. Die AfD stimmte als einzige Fraktion gegen den Bedarfsplan.
Eltern von der Entscheidung enttäuscht
Eltern zeigten sich enttäuscht von der Entscheidung, die mit 24 Ja, vier Nein-Stimmen und neun Enthaltungen den Stadtrat passiert hat. Sie hingen nun in der Luft und müssten sich mit ihren Trägern beraten. Schließen werden die Kindergärten in Taubach, Gelmeroda, der Kulturkindergarten am Goethepark und Benjamin Blümchen. Die Kita Tröbsdorf wurde bereits leer gezogen.
MDR (cma/jn)
Dieses Thema im Programm: MDR THÜRINGEN - Das Radio | Regionalnachrichten | 26. Juni 2025 | 07:30 Uhr

author: Dimitri Charitsis
title: Audi Q6 e-tron : le meilleur SUV électrique du moment ?
text:
Ne jamais juger au premier coup dâ€™Å“il. DerriÃ¨re un design sans ambition ou sans relief peut parfois se cacher un trÃ©sor de technicitÃ©. Lâ€™adage vaut pour les essais automobiles comme pour le reste, mais disons que dans le premier cas les surprises sont plus rares. Câ€™est Ã ce genre dâ€™Ã©tonnement que nous avons pourtant Ã©tÃ© confrontÃ©s avec lâ€™
Audi Q6 e-tron. Non pas que son esthÃ©tique soit indigne, au contraire, mais son classicisme nâ€™avait pas soulevÃ© en nous un vent dâ€™optimisme Ã lâ€™idÃ©e dâ€™en prendre le volant.
Pourtant, aux termes dâ€™un essai atypique, dans lequel le Q6 e-tron nâ€™a pas Ã©tÃ© placÃ© dans des conditions favorables, le SUV dâ€™Audi a fait part dâ€™un rare talent et dâ€™un niveau de performance emballant. Câ€™est cet essai, sur les routes escarpÃ©es du Pays-Basque que nous avons choisi de vous raconter.
Un SUV Audi de plus ?
Lâ€™histoire de ce Q6, ne commence pourtant pas de la meilleure des maniÃ¨res. Câ€™est celle dâ€™un espace quâ€™Audi nâ€™a pas voulu laisser vacant. Entre les 4,59 m du
Q4 e-tron et les 4,92 m du Q8 e-tron, la firme dâ€™Ingolstadt sâ€™est dit quâ€™il y avait de la place pour un SUV de plus au catalogue. Un vÃ©hicule qui aura accumulÃ© les retards et qui aura dÃ» laisser (au terme dâ€™un dÃ©veloppement laborieux) Ã son prestigieux cousin le Porsche Macan, le soin dâ€™Ã©trenner leur plateforme commune, la bien nommÃ©e PPE (Premium Platform Electric) et ses allÃ©chants 800 V.
MÃªme designer joue encore
Nous ne reviendrons pas trop longuement sur lâ€™esthÃ©tique du Q6 e-tron. Cette question a dÃ©jÃ fait lâ€™objet dâ€™un article et dâ€™une vidÃ©o lors de notre dÃ©couverte en avant-premiÃ¨re du dernier SUV dâ€™Audi. Lâ€™arrivÃ©e du Q6 e-tron dans la gamme Ã©lectrique dâ€™Audi rÃ©pond sans doute Ã une exigence commerciale quâ€™il est difficile dâ€™apprÃ©hender. La firme aux quatre anneaux est convaincue quâ€™il y avait non pas une place, mais une nÃ©cessitÃ© de proposer un nouveau modÃ¨le entre un Q4 e-tron (qui serait trop petit pour certains clients) et un Q8 e-tron qui pourrait paraÃ®tre surdimensionnÃ©. Ainsi, alors mÃªme quâ€™il Ã©tait actÃ© que le prochain vÃ©hicule basculerait sur la plateforme de nouvelle gÃ©nÃ©ration du groupe, la PPE, le Q6 se devait de respecter un minimum de cohÃ©rence stylistique.
Cela explique Ã bien des Ã©gards pourquoi la prise de risque est moindre sur le design du Q6 e-tron, notamment en comparaison de ce qui se passe sous le capot et sous le plancher. Vous lâ€™aurez compris, lâ€™esthÃ©tique du Q6 e-tron nâ€™a rien de rÃ©volutionnaire, elle sâ€™inscrit complÃ¨tement dans la voie qu’ont tracÃ©e les derniers SUV dâ€™Audi, mais ce nâ€™est pas une raison pour lui en tenir rigueur.
Un habitacle de nouvelle gÃ©nÃ©ration
De nouveau design il en est question en revanche dans lâ€™
habitacle de ce Q6 e-tron. Audi a complÃ¨tement revu sa planche de bord pour passer au Â« digital stage Â», un systÃ¨me Ã triple Ã©cran rÃ©solument futuriste et, il faut lâ€™avouer, trÃ¨s stylÃ©. Aux deux Ã©crans principaux (11,9 pouces pour lâ€™instrumentation, 14,5 pouces pour les mÃ©dias) sâ€™ajoute un troisiÃ¨me affichage, en option, pour le passager. Telle est la tendance dÃ©sormais sur les vÃ©hicules premium, et si on peut toujours sâ€™interroger sur lâ€™intÃ©rÃªt dâ€™un Ã©cran de plus, force est de constater quâ€™il trouve sa place presque naturellement dans cette nouvelle planche de bord.
Pour gouverner cet ensemble, câ€™est encore une fois le systÃ¨me MMI qui est Ã la manÅ“uvre, cette fois basÃ© sur une architecture Android Automotive quâ€™Audi a souhaitÃ©e trÃ¨s discrÃ¨te. MalgrÃ© les possibilitÃ©s de sâ€™appuyer sur un environnement Google, Audi privilÃ©gie sa propre interface et ce nâ€™est pas toujours heureux. Si celle-ci a pu, par le passÃ©, apparaÃ®tre comme un modÃ¨le Ã suivre, ce nâ€™est dÃ©sormais plus le cas. VÃ©ritable usine Ã gaz, elle met les nerfs du conducteur Ã lâ€™Ã©preuve dÃ¨s lors quâ€™il sâ€™agit de modifier un rÃ©glage quelconque. Soyons clairs, MMI ne manque pas de possibilitÃ©s de personnalisation, ni dâ€™options (le nombre de rÃ©glages sur le comportement de la voiture en atteste), mais elle souffre dâ€™un manque cruel dâ€™intuition et dâ€™ergonomie. Un exemple : le mode de fonctionnement du freinage rÃ©gÃ©nÃ©ratif est une aberration alors mÃªme quâ€™il est lâ€™un des plus complets et lâ€™un des plus aboutis du marchÃ©.
Que vaut le Q6 e-tron sur la route ?
Nâ€™y allons pas par quatre chemins, le Q6 e-tron nous a emballÃ© comme rarement un SUV Ã©lectrique ne lâ€™avait fait jusquâ€™ici (hormis peut Ãªtre le trÃ¨s atypique Ioniq 5 N, mais dans un style trÃ¨s diffÃ©rent). Le dernier nÃ© des SUV dâ€™Audi est non seulement des plus plaisants Ã conduire mais il fait aussi preuve dâ€™une rare personnalitÃ©. Son chÃ¢ssis efficace et prÃ©cis est sa principale rÃ©ussite. Ã€ tel point que mÃªme dans les montagnes escarpÃ©es du Pays Basque, le Q6 avec ses 4,71 m et ses 2 350 kg sur la balance se balade comme un chat entre les gouttiÃ¨res.
Et lorsquâ€™il faut montrer les muscles ? Aucun souci, ses 580 Nm sont lÃ , en soutien dâ€™une direction ferme et prÃ©cise, notamment dans un mode Â« Sport Â» quâ€™on ne peut que recommander vivement. Le bilan est Ã©galement plus que satisfaisant en matiÃ¨re de suspension, celle-ci sâ€™avÃ©rant efficace et adaptÃ©e quel que soit le style de conduite pour lequel on opte. En revanche, il convient dâ€™ajouter que notre modÃ¨le dâ€™essai Ã©tait pourvu des suspensions pilotÃ©es, une option Ã 2 260 euros, qui nous semble indispensable pour tirer profit des capacitÃ©s du Q6 e-tron, mais qui aurait dÃ» Ãªtre proposÃ©e de sÃ©rie.
Un bijou de technologie
La cousine de la Porsche Macan frappe donc trÃ¨s fort en termes de conduite et les ingÃ©nieurs dâ€™Audi ne sâ€™y sont pas trompÃ©s lorsquâ€™ils ont optÃ© pour un systÃ¨me Ã double moteur mais basÃ© sur des technologies diffÃ©rentes. En effet, contrairement Ã la majoritÃ© des constructeurs qui optent pour des moteurs Ã©lectriques Ã aimants permanents, Audi a fait le choix de rÃ©server ce procÃ©dÃ© uniquement au moteur arriÃ¨re. Ã€ lâ€™avant, câ€™est un moteur asynchrone Ã induction qui a Ã©tÃ© choisi. Sa spÃ©cificitÃ© ? Il est totalement dÃ©sengagÃ© lorsquâ€™il nâ€™est pas utilisÃ©, sans consommation dâ€™Ã©lectricitÃ© ni freinage passif. En revanche, lorsquâ€™il vient en soutien du moteur arriÃ¨re, son efficacitÃ© est redoutable, et la consommation dâ€™Ã©nergie reste maÃ®trisÃ©e.
Autonomie : merci la grosse batterie (et le 800 V)
DotÃ© de qualitÃ©s dynamiques rares, le Q6 e-tron parvient-il Ã doubler la mise avec une autonomie qui lui permettrait dâ€™Ãªtre catÃ©gorisÃ© parmi les grands voyageurs ? Ã€ cette question, notre rÃ©ponse sera malheureusement incomplÃ¨te. Doublement incomplÃ¨te mÃªme, puisquâ€™en plus de nâ€™avoir pas pu rouler suffisamment pour avoir un aperÃ§u complet de la consommation du SUV, il nous faut souligner que notre essai sâ€™est essentiellement dÃ©roulÃ© sur les routes montagneuses du Pays-Basque. Autrement dit, la consommation que nous avons constatÃ©e peut difficilement sâ€™appliquer Ã un usage classique, urbain ou mÃªme mixte. Certes, quelques portions autoroutiÃ¨res sur notre parcours ou encore un crochet prÃ¨s de San Sebastian permettent dâ€™avoir un aperÃ§u de lâ€™autonomie rÃ©elle du Q6 e-tron, mais il nous faudra sans doute complÃ©ter ce premier essai par un autre pour avoir une indication fiable de la consommation rÃ©elle du dernier-nÃ© des SUV dâ€™Audi.
Toujours est-il quâ€™au terme de notre pÃ©riple, la consommation sâ€™est Ã©tablie Ã 22,8 kWh/100 km. Câ€™est un chiffre relativement important dans lâ€™absolu, mais plutÃ´t intÃ©ressant sur un parcours essentiellement montagneux et si on prend en compte le gabarit imposant du SUV. Pour contrer sa consommation Ã©levÃ©e, le Q6 e-tron a deux atouts majeurs : une Ã©norme batterie de 100 kW et une capacitÃ© de recharge rapide ultra Ã©levÃ©e Ã 270 kW. Ces deux mÃ©ritent-elles quâ€™on snobe complÃ¨tement la partie efficience ? Certainement pas, mais il nâ€™en demeure pas moins que le dernier SUV dâ€™Audi posera rarement des soucis en matiÃ¨re dâ€™autonomie. Dâ€™une part parce quâ€™en conditions idÃ©ales sa grosse batterie peut le porter, thÃ©oriquement, sur 623 km. Dâ€™autre part parce que dans les cas oÃ¹ il faudrait passer par la case recharge, celle-ci s’effectuera en un temps record. Le constructeur avance deux chiffres en la matiÃ¨re : un 10 % Ã 80 % en 21 mn ou la possibilitÃ© de rÃ©cupÃ©rer 255 km dâ€™autonomie en 10 min de recharge sur une borne rapide. Ces valeurs sâ€™entendent dans des conditions idÃ©ales bien sÃ»r mais elles en disent aussi trÃ¨s long sur les performances dont le Q6 est capable. Enfin, il est un dernier Ã©lÃ©ment sur lequel Audi sâ€™appuie considÃ©rablement : une courbe de recharge trÃ¨s bien tenue qui permettrait au SUV de tenir son pic de puissance mais aussi de continuer Ã charger Ã 150 kW mÃªme Ã 70 % de batterie. Sur ce point Ã©galement un test plus long, axÃ© sur lâ€™autonomie, devrait permettre de confirmer ou dâ€™infirmer les chiffres.
Le prix de la haute performance
Alors bien sÃ»r, comme souvent chez Audi, il y a lâ€™Ã©ternelle question du prix. Compte tenu du niveau technologique de la bÃªte et de ses penchants pour le premium, la facture est naturellement salÃ©e. La version de base du Q6 e-tron dÃ©bute Ã 83 450 euros, une paille. Quant Ã notre modÃ¨le de test, la solide SQ6 e-tron, elle frise les 100 000 euros dans sa version la plus classique, sans option Ã 99 870 euros. Ã€ ce niveau de prix, il nâ€™y a pas beaucoup de concurrence sÃ©rieuse, certes, mais il nâ€™y a pas beaucoup dâ€™acheteurs non plus.
Verdict du test :
Vous lâ€™aurez compris, nous avons adorÃ© lâ€™Audi Q6 e-tron. Nous nous attendions Ã Ãªtre quelque peu dÃ©Ã§us ou du moins peu emballÃ©s. Ce sentiment nÃ© au lendemain dâ€™une officialisation dâ€™un design trÃ¨s sage a volÃ© en Ã©clats dÃ¨s lors que nous avons pris le volant du nouveau SUV Ã©lectrique dâ€™Audi. Son Ã©quipement complet, son niveau de technicitÃ© Ã©levÃ©, mais surtout ses qualitÃ©s dynamiques rares en font un vÃ©hicule Ã©lectrique trÃ¨s rÃ©ussi. Certes, le bilan nâ€™est pas parfait avec notamment une consommation Ã©nergÃ©tique quâ€™Audi nâ€™a pas rÃ©ussi Ã rÃ©duire suffisamment. Ce point qui aurait Ã©tÃ© rÃ©dhibitoire sur une quantitÃ© de modÃ¨les, nâ€™empÃªche pas le Q6 e-tron de marquer les esprits. Sa surconsommation, le SUV dâ€™Audi la compense avec une batterie gigantesque et une vitesse de recharge record. Certes, le procÃ©dÃ© manque de finesse, mais le rÃ©sultat demeure satisfaisant. Dommage aussi pour lâ€™interface qui ne permet pas de profiter agrÃ©ablement des innombrables possibilitÃ©s de personnalisation du SUV. Au final, le Q6 e-tron offre une polyvalence rare. Celle dâ€™un vÃ©hicule Ã la fois capable de longs voyages en Ã©lectrique, mais aussi de sacrÃ©es sensations sur la route.

author: S Madhumitha
title: KUHS Result 2025 Released at kuhs.ac.in Direct Link to Download UG Course Result
text:
KUHS Results 2025
KUHS Result 2025 OUT! Kerala University of Health Sciences (KUHS) has released the 2025 results for various UG and PG courses on its official website. Students can check your results now via the official website using the direct link and instructions provided below.
KUHS Results 2025 Out – Check B.Sc/B.Pharm Results at kuhs.ac.in
KUHS has officially announced the KUHS Results 2025 (UG Course) for various undergraduate and postgraduate programs, including B.Sc/B.Pharm Students who appeared for these exams can now check their results online at kuhs.ac.in. To access the KUHS Result PDF, candidates must enter their roll number. Use the direct link below to download your mark sheet and check your result.
KUHS Result 2025 Overview
University Name | Kerala University of Health Sciences |
Name of Exam | B.Sc/B.Pharm |
Course | UG Course |
Category | Result |
Result Status | Released |
Official Site |
|
Click HereClick HereClick HereHow to Check the KUHS Results 2025?
Kerala University of Health Sciences announces its results online through the official website. To access their results, students must visit the website and locate the designated result link. Since the results are not publicly available, students are required to enter their roll number to view their individual scores.
- Go to KUHS’s official website kuhs.ac.in
- Look for the “Results” or “Examination” tab on the homepage.
- Select Your Course & Semester
- Click on the relevant link for your course (B.Sc/B.Pharm etc..).
- Enter your Roll Number, Registration Number, or other required credentials.
- Click on the submit button to view your result.
- Download and print your mark sheet for future reference.
KUHS Results 2025: Direct Links to Download UG Course Result
Course Name | Result Release Date | Result Link |

|

author: News desk
title: 127 kanal land worth Rs255.4m retrieved from mafia
text:
Bashir Ahmad Rehmani Hafizabad
On the directions of the Deputy Commissioner Hafizabad, Assistant Commissioner Pindi Bhatttian Rashid Iqbal retrieved 127 kinal and 16 marla government land from land mafia worth Rs.255.4 million. According to report, Mehdi Hassan and Muhammad Zabair had grabbed since long. Further legal action would be taken against grabbers.
On the other hand Deputy Commissioner, District Returning Officer Hafizabad Sundas Irshad visited election training centre Government Islamia Collage for women Hafizabad. She review process of training being imparted to polling staff appointed by the election commission to hold free, fair and transparent general election on 8, February and took feedback regarding standard of training.
ADCG Hamad Ullah, member election monitoring team Assistant Director Environment HafizabadNaveed Ahmad and other officers also accompanied by her. DC directed the polling staff to perform their election duties honestly and impartially and any negligence and slackness would not be tolerated in this regards.
The DC was informed that two training centres have been established at Hafizabad and Pindi Bhattian each for giving election training to more than 6500 employees of different departments deputed by the election commission while the best and satisfactory training arrangements have been made at both training centres.
Meanwhile Chief Executive Officer Education Sohail Azhar Khan and District Education Officer Elementary Hafizabad SaminaYasmiinhas suspended 33 male and female teachers for not attending election training conducted by the Election Commission in the district.
CEO suspended Hub-e-Haider, Sagir Ahmad, Arshad, Muhammad Nawaz, Ehasan Elahi, Muhammad Tahir Usman, Sher Afghan, Rashid Mehmood, Zulifiqar Ali, Riaz Ahmad, Mazhar Hussain, Ansar Abbas, Tahir Abbas, Shahzad Ahmad, Waseem Akram, Muhammad Arrrshad, Manzoor Abbas, Zahid Anjum, and Muhammad Bashir Secondary School Teachers due to found absent from election training according to schedule issued by the election commission.
DEO (EE-W) SaminaYasmin suspended Elementary School Teachers Shagufta Munir, Nazio Hayyat, Saima Afzal, Muqadas Tahira, Raffia Abbas, Bushara Naz, Abida Nasreen, Munawara Sultana, Naima Rasul, Anila Asim, Asmma Ijaz, Riasat Ali, Humma Basharat and Gull Faria from service for not attending election training.
